page.title: 04Sharnbrook Playgroup
page.content: Sharnbrook Playgroup provides experiences in{co-operation and {learning for the three to five year {olds.} It is run by a committee of mothers who appoint playleaders and organise the finances. {Play}with sand, water and paint, while satisfying in itself, also encourages manipulative skills and introduces awareness of texture. {Physical activities}- dance, exercise and climbing promote co-ordination which leads to agility. {Imaginative {play,}fostered through dressing up, wendy house play or pretend hospitals enables the child to learn about real world situations. He is also learning about friendship, sharing, communicating and co-operating with others. The child learns gradual independence from home in a safe, exciting environment.
